title: Motorcycle License — Study Guide
description: Master motorcycle safety, road positioning, and visibility for the Voxel test.

items.question: Can you ride on public roads in this way?
items.explanation: Riding in this manner is unsafe and against traffic rules. Always maintain proper road discipline regardless of other vehicles.

items.question: As you approach the center of a turn, you should
items.explanation: Slowing down maintains control and prevents skidding when cornering.

items.question: When approaching an intersection, you should select a lane position to
items.explanation: Choosing a lane that increases visibility helps you and other drivers anticipate movements safely.

items.question: What are the requirements for wearing a helmet?
items.explanation: Helmets are required for all riders and passengers. They are the most important protection against head injury.

items.question: Grabbing the front brake or jamming down on the rear brake.
items.explanation: Sudden braking causes wheel lock. Controlled braking is key to stopping safely.

items.question: Passengers on motorcycles should
items.explanation: Passengers should sit close but not crowding, keeping balance and stability.

items.question: When riding with a group of motorcyclists, a staggered formation
items.explanation: Side-by-side riding reduces maneuvering space. A staggered or single-file is safest in certain situations.

items.question: You should operate the engine cut-off switch and pull in the clutch when
items.explanation: During emergencies, shutting off the engine and clutching prevents further loss of control.

items.question: Before changing lanes on a multilane road, you should check
items.explanation: Always check both the immediate and far lanes to avoid blind spot collisions.

items.question: When riding in a group, the best formation is the ___ formation.
items.explanation: Single-file is safest in tight or hazardous conditions, though staggered is often used on open roads.

items.question: When making a slow, tight turn, the rider should
items.explanation: Keeping the body upright and leaning the bike improves control at low speeds.

items.question: Is it safe to over take this vehicle?
items.explanation: Never overtake when visibility or conditions are unsafe.

items.question: Most of your motorcycles stopping power is provided by
items.explanation: The front brake provides the majority of stopping power due to weight transfer.

items.question: If your motorcycle starts to wobble, your best course of action is to
items.explanation: Do not fight the wobble or accelerate. Gradually close the throttle and slow down.

items.question: Surfaces that provide little traction for a motorcycle include
items.explanation: Gravel and loose surfaces significantly reduce traction and increase risk of falls.

items.question: Increase your safety at night by
items.explanation: Combining lighting, safe distance, and helmets maximizes nighttime safety.

items.question: When following a vehicle, you should maintain a ___ or more second following distance.
items.explanation: A three-second gap allows enough time to react safely.

items.question: What is the speed limit for lane filtering?
items.explanation: Lane filtering is only permitted under 30km/h for safety.
